item.title: Economic Sustainability of Open-Source Projects â€” Daily KBC Note (2026-02-10)
item.description:
The Economic Sustainability of Open-Source Projects

In today’s digital age, open-source projects have become essential components of the technology ecosystem. These projects rely on collaborative contributions from a diverse community of developers, designers, and other experts to create software that is freely available for anyone to use, modify, and distribute. However, ensuring the economic sustainability of open-source projects remains a challenge, as contributors often struggle to find ways to monetize their work and sustain their efforts in the long term.
